title: BBC Local Live: Sheffield and South Yorkshire on Thursday 10 November 2016 - BBC News
summary: father-of-seven from barnsley tells of croydon tram crash ordeal .
rogue landlord to pay £ 29,200 after city 's biggest case .
cannabis worth £ 250,000 found in rotherham police raid .

documents.title: five things we learned today
text: that 's it from me for today .
i 'll be back tomorrow from 08:00 with all the latest news , weather , travel and sport from across south yorkshire .
here are five things we 've learned today
but before i go , take a look at this great photo showing a real mix of weather conditions in wortley sent in by our weather watcher john
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: how to spend a weekend in sheffield - an insider 's guide
text: 48 hours .
one city .
ours .
the i newspaper has come up with an insider 's guide on how to spend 48 hours in sheffield .
what would you advise tourists to do on a visit to south yorkshire ?
tweet us your thoughts or drop us an e-mail !
author: The I

documents.title: teenager charged over string of robberies in rotherham
text: a 16-year-old boy has been charged with a range of offences after a string of robberies in the clifton park area of rotherham .
he was charged with five counts of robbery , one count of attempted robbery , possession of cannabis and failure to comply with a drug treatment and detention order after being arrested by police .
the teenager denies the offences and has been remanded in custody until his next appearance at sheffield crown court in december .
author: Claire Renwick
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: e-fit released after alleged sex assault on 16-year-old girl in sheffield
text: police in sheffield have released an e-fit of a man they want to speak to in connection with an alleged sexual assault on a 16-year-old girl .
the teenager was travelling on the 52a bus from wisewood to woodhouse in july when a man sat down next to her and sexually assaulted her before getting off the bus on beaver hill road .
anyone who might recognise the man or have information about the incident , which took place at around 17:30 on 30 july , is being asked to contact police on 101 .
this was a highly traumatic incident for the victim and we are continuing to follow up on a number of lines of inquiry .
i would like to ask any members of the public who think they know the man in the e-fit to speak to police as we believe he could assist us with our investigation . ''
author: Claire Renwick
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: weather : clear , cool and frosty night for south yorkshire
text: it 'll be a dry and clear evening tonight and that means only one thing frost .
tomorrow is set to be a sunny day and about as chilly as today .
there 'll be some rain on saturday , but sunday will be drier .
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: barnsley mp dan jarvis backs fa in poppy row
text: dan jarvis , the mp for barnsley central , has backed the football association in its dispute over whether players will be allowed to wear poppy armbands .
football 's governing body fifa says the poppy is a political symbol and has banned it .
but the fa says it will defy the ban when england play scotland at wembley tomorrow night in a world cup 2018 qualifier .
on @ twitterid offering support to the @ twitterid & @ twitterid for giving footballers the choice to wear a poppy on # remembranceday # lestweforget .
ca n't watch it here , so i 'll presume you also defend the right to not wear a poppy , and will actively defend those who opt out .
yes , i 've always been clear that people should have the right to wear , or not wear a poppy as they see fit .
so we 'll see you loudly defending , say , james mcclean , with a big piece in the sun ?
you 'll tour the tv studios ?
cool !
the thing is , over even my lifetime , the pressure to wear a poppy has grown tremendously , and what was once a remembrance
of the tragedy of the industrial scale destruction of human life and dignity is morphing into a celebration of 'heroes ' .
good but they should have ignored fa and worn them .
faso many scots died fighting for us .
respect

documents.title: several weeks delay likely before chesterfield devolution decision
text: i 've been at the high court in london listening to two authorities fight over chesterfield .
the borough council wants to join the sheffield city region 's devolution deal - but derbyshire county council says a consultation on the plans was n't carried out properly .
yesterday , derbyshire made their case , today it was the city region 's turn :
but after two days the case has still not been resolved .
mr justice ouseley who is hearing the case says he 'll make a reserved judgment on the case , which means we may not know the outcome for several weeks .
@ sheffcityregion lawyer takes on @ twitterid point abt whethr police boundaries cld change bcos of scr deal .
`` no '' he says-it ca n't happen
scr lawyer tells court the only power being taken away from @ twitterid & given to scr mayor is transport : '' we 're not opening pandora 's box ''
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Radio Sheffield Political Reporter

documents.title: search for missing barnsley teenager
text: police are appealing for help to find a missing barnsley teenager .
fifteen-year-old amber mitchell was last seen in stocksbridge on tuesday .
amber is about 5ft tall with long brown hair and is thought to be wearing a green parka-style jacket and black leggings .
anyone who has seen amber is asked to call south yorkshire police on 101 .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: man guilty of shaking baby to death
text: man guilty of shaking baby to death

documents.title: hundreds of cannabis plants worth £ 250,000 found in rotherham drugs raid
text: police in rotherham have found 400 cannabis plants after carrying out a drugs raid in parkgate .
officers estimate the drug has a street value of £ 250,000 .
police did n't make any arrests but say their investigations are continuing .
the plants were seized and the equipment used to grow them was destroyed .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: ched evans has 'a lot of support ' from fans - chesterfield boss
text: i 've been speaking to chesterfield boss danny wilson ahead of sunday 's match against sheffield united .
ched evans currently plays for the spireites but previously was a blade .
danny wilson believes evans will have `` a lot of support '' from both sets of fans after his rape conviction was quashed .
author: Jonathan Buchan
BBC Radio Sheffield Sport

documents.title: 'missed opportunities ' to prevent doncaster shaken baby death
text: a serious .
case review after death of an 11-week-old boy has found there were missed opportunities to save him .
james larkin , 26 , of crawshaw road , doncaster , shook christopher at their home on 16 september 2014 .
the baby died in hospital two days later .
at sheffield crown court , larkin was also found guilty of conspiracy to pervert the course of justice .
christopher 's mother laura ostle , 21 , of broadway , was also found guilty of the perverting justice offence
now doncaster 's children 's safeguarding board has made eight recommendations to help protect children in the future .
the review found information was n't being shared between authorities and not enough questions were being asked .
it also found social workers did not act quickly enough after concerns were raised .
however , the chair of the doncaster safeguarding children board said a more robust approach to risk '' had been adopted and such a tragedy was `` less likely '' to happen again .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: 'bodies everywhere ' - barnsley man recalls nightmare of tram crash
text: kevin snow , 57 , was on the croydon tram which derailed , killing seven people .
the father-of-seven from barnsley recalled the `` horrendous '' crash and said he feared to get on a tram again .

documents.title: weekend stargazers to enjoy biggest 'supermoon ' since 1948
text: if you 're up late on sunday night you could be in for an astronomical treat - a view of the biggest `` supermoon '' in 68 years .
on the night of the 13/14 november , the moon will come closer to earth than at any point since 1948 .
it will appear up to 30 % brighter and 14 % bigger than an average full moon , according to nasa .
it will be the brightest and largest of three `` supermoons '' to occur in 2016 .
the first came on 16 october 16 with the third due on 14 december .

documents.title: man charged over rotherham burglary
text: a 49-year-old man from thurcroft has been charged with burglary by detectives in rotherham .
it 's linked to an incident on nursery road in north anston where items including cash and jewellery were stolen .
richard brown , of katherine street in thurcroft , appeared at sheffield magistrates ' court on tuesday .
he 's been remanded in custody to appear there again next month .
author: BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: let 's take a look at the top stories across south yorkshire
author: Claire Renwick
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: hanging on the telephone police commissioner raises 101 concerns
text: if you 've tried to ring 101 to get hold of south yorkshire police you may have faced a long wait .
south yorkshire 's police and crime commissioner says he 's had `` numerous complaints '' made to him about delays in getting through .
some people have told dr alan billings they 're waiting up to 40 minutes for an answer .
he has said the it system is not fit for purpose and has asked south yorkshire police for an update on a review of the system .
south yorkshire police says it has hired 10 extra call handlers and six more force crime bureau staff .
it said a further 17 staff were in training for roles and 23.9 vacancies had been advertised .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: weather : cold and clear with a chance of ice
text: it 's a bright but cold day across south yorkshire and that 's set to continue overnight .
author: Owain Wyn Evans
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: dodgy sheffield landlord guilty in city 's biggest case yet
text: a rogue landlord is out of pocket by £ 29,200 after being prosecuted for 56 offences - the biggest case ever brought by sheffield city council .

john mark cashin , 47 , of overlow lane in baslow , was found guilty of a range of offences relating to five houses on abbeydale road , violet bank road , vincent road , fieldhead road and glover road with issues including :
cashin ignored notices from the council and was fined £ 11,400 at sheffield magistrates court and ordered to pay £ 17,800 in costs .
he had previously been prosecuted for 27 offences and fined £ 2,700 last year .
the latest case was the result of months of work by sheffield city council .
some of cashin 's former tenants and business associates said they were pleased with the result :
the guy ruined my life .
it was horrible and the house was a complete disaster - three or four windows were broken so it was completely freezing .
and there were times when we had no electricity for three or four days and he did n't care . ''
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: e-by-gum-bay ! sheffield 's historic tooth buyers and sellers
text: sheffield libraries have hit upon a gem here !
or should that be gum ?
it 's an advert for an old shop which bought and sold teeth
i wonder what they did if you want your money back ?
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: weather : feelin ' cold , cold , cold
text: so shall i start with the good news ?
it 'll get brighter throughout the afternoon and will stay dry
but , on the downside , the clear skies mean it 'll be very cold overnight .
de-icers on standby !
de-icer on standby high pressure builds tonight it 's going to be cold
@ twitterid owain , it 's a bit 'nippy noodles ' now , never mind tomorrow !
author: Owain Wyn Evans
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: five men arrested in rotherham on sus of rape are bailed
text: we 've had an update from the national crime agency ( nca ) on the five men arrested in rotherham yesterday on sus of conspiracy to rape .
they have all been bailed until april as the nca 's investigations into child sex abuse in the town continue .
author: BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: 'bruised , battered but alive ' says barnsley man in croydon tram crash
text: you 'll have heard about the horrific tram crash in croydon yesterday which killed seven people .
kevin snow , a ceiling fitter from barnsley , was working in the capital and heading to work on the tram when it happened .
his wife diane told us that his life was saved because he got on at a different stop .
i spoke to kevin earlier and began by finding out how he 's doing
author: Toby Foster
Presenter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: headlines : the top stories making the news in south yorkshire
text: let 's take a look at the news headlines for south yorkshire
author: Everard Davy
BBC Radio Sheffield News

documents.title: work continues to redevelop barnsley town centre
text: we 're a couple of weeks into the £ 100m redevelopment of barnsley town centre - how 's it all going ?
work continues on the new market , a public square and a new £ 4m community facility and library will follow .
they 'll replace the former shops opposite the may day green market at the corner of kendray street and eldon street .
get a look at their work below
author: Mick Lunney
Barnsley reporter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: `` change of stop saved his life '' wife of barnsley man injured in croydon tram crash says
text: the wife of a man on the croydon tram which crashed yesterday killing seven people says getting on at a different stop saved his life .
ceiling fitter kevin snow has been working in london but was in a different position on the tram than usual because he did n't wait in the usual place
he 's been left with bruises on his shoulder and a bad back after the incident .
i began by asking diane what kevin had told her when he called after the crash
the driver of the tram involved in the crash is being questioned by police on sus of manslaughter .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Radio heffield

documents.title: remember these ? vintage cop cars go in for repair
text: south yorkshire police has been down to the garage
these vintage cars have been in for repair - can you remember seeing them on the streets ?
share your memories with us on twitter or e-mail them in !
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: duke of kent opens new £ 18 million barnsley college campus
text: barnsley had a vip visit yesterday .
the duke of kent opened barnsley college 's new £ 18 million sixth form campus , he was given a tour and spent time chatting to students and staff .
i was really excited to meet his royal highness .
it 's a great opportunity and i 'm pleased i was chosen to be a part of this event . ''
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: sheffield cemetery gets a new lease of life after 50 years
text: a building in sheffield 's general cemetery has been given a new lease of life after lying derelict for 50 years .
£ 270,000 was spent restoring the grade ii listed non-conformist chapel to turn it into a cultural and arts centre .
it went from this
to this
author: Everard Davy
BBC Radio Sheffield News

documents.title: weather : sunshine , showers and no sign of snow
text: good morning !
i 'm glad to say we 've got no sign of the white stuff - but it 'll still feel cold out there .
but take your brolly as we 'll see a mix of sunshine and showers .
i 've got the full forecast for you below
author: Owain Wyn Evans
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage
text: good morning , it 's kevin here
i 'll be with you until 18:00 with all the latest news , weather , travel and sport for south yorkshire .
fortunately , no snowy scenes this morning but take a look at this great photo of the fields in penistone yesterday :
thanks to our bbc weather watcher briggsy for that
if you 've got some great photos or a story to share , we 'd love to hear from you - tweet us on @ twitterid or why not e-mail us ?
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Radio Sheffield
